metadata.title: CVE-2023-52678 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:drm/amdkfd: Confirm list is non-empty before utilizing list_first_entry inkfd_topology.c Before using list_first_entry, make sure to check that listis not empty, if list is empty return -ENODATA. Fixes the below:drivers/gpu/drm/amd/amdgpu/../amdkfd/kfd_topology.c:1347kfd_create_indirect_link_prop() warn: can 'gpu_link' even be NULL?drivers/gpu/drm/amd/amdgpu/../amdkfd/kfd_topology.c:1428kfd_add_peer_prop() warn: can 'iolink1' even be NULL?drivers/gpu/drm/amd/amdgpu/../amdkfd/kfd_topology.c:1433kfd_add_peer_prop() warn: can 'iolink2' even be NULL?

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-52678` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.13.0-173-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.13.0-173-generic-lpae - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.13.0-173-lowlatency - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.13.0-173-powerpc-e500 - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.13.0-173-powerpc-e500mc - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.13.0-173-powerpc-smp - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.13.0-173-powerpc64-emb - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.13.0-173-powerpc64-smp - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-unsigned-3.13.0-173-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-unsigned-3.13.0-173-lowlatency - 3.11.0-12.19
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-164-generic - 4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-164-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-164-lowlatency - 4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-164-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-164-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-164-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-164-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-164-generic - 4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-164-lowlatency - 4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1054-aws - 4.4.0-1002.2

linux-lts-xenial package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1').
